alert.note: Alert for Christian; Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 8:23PM CDT until March 27 at 12:36PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... James River NEAR Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Boaz. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Water approaches structures near the river. Approximate level of the one percent chance flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Friday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 02/25/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
